Oklahoma_City.Chase Tower (Oklahoma City): Cotter Ranch Tower, also known as Chase Tower, is a signature skyscraper in Oklahoma City's central business district. Previously known as Liberty Tower (the name it had upon completion) and Bank One Tower, (BankOne later merging into JP Morgan, Chase) the building is now named Cotter Tower, after its owner, real estate holdings owner James Cotter of San Antonio, Texas. At 152.4 meters (500 feet), it is the second tallest building in the city and the sixth tallest in the state of Oklahoma.
